title: About
text:
Maya McCain
I am a third-year student at Colorado State University studying Ecosystem Science & Sustainability. I have an interest in freshwater systems, so I am minoring in Watershed Science. I aspire to connect my knowledge in both realms in order to forge a fulfilling career in the natural resources field.
I have experience doing undergraduate research with the Cusack Ecosystem Lab focusing on drought in tropical ecosystems and its effects on root and soil dynamics. During my participation in a watershed science field course, I gained hands-on experience with active restoration projects. Learning about globalization and sustainable development from a study abroad course in Costa Rica provided me with a new perspective on how natural resources are handled around the world.
In my free time, I enjoy participating in outdoor activities such as climbing, skiing, slack-lining, backpacking, and more. I am fond of building my community and listening to live music as well.

title: Resume
text:
Maya McCain
Fort Collins, CO
SUMMARY
I am a motivated student at Colorado State University with field course, research, restaurant, and volunteer experience. My passion for the natural world drives me to pursue a career in the natural resources field. My strengths include strong observational skills, adaptability in field conditions, teamwork, and proficiency in data collection.
EDUCATION
Colorado State University, B.S. Ecosystem Science and Sustainability, Minor in Watershed Science August 2024-Present 4.0 GPA, Anticipated Graduation May 2026 Fort Collins, Colorado Cal Poly Humboldt, Environmental Science and Management, Two years completed August 2022-May 2024 4.0 GPA Arcata, California
RELEVANT EXPERIENCE
Undergraduate Research Assistant, Cusack Ecosystem Lab September 2024 - Present Fort Collins, Colorado Processing tropical soils by weighing, drying, and recording measurements ensuring accurate data collection Effectively communicating with colleagues, graduate students, and professors to establish a collaborative work environment
Watershed Science Field Course, Mattole Restoration Council May 13 - May 17, 2024 Petrolia, California Participated in hands-on experiences with active restoration projects Volunteered at the Mattole Native Plant Nursery processing seeds and planting starters Learned from professionals working on different aspects of restoration, including the use of prescribed burning
Server/Host, The Pub at the Creamery March 2023 - May 2024 Arcata, California Provided customer service in a fast-paced environment, ensuring a positive dining experience Efficiently took orders from and served guests while effectively managing multiple tables Trained new employees on restaurant protocols, menu items, and customer service techniques Efficiently communicated with the kitchen, serving, and bartending staff to ensure good service
International Environmental Issues and Globalization Study Abroad Course, Earth Education International San Ramon, Costa Rica May 22 - June 2, 2023 Engaged with different aspects of sustainable development and ecotourism in Costa Rica Visited a hydroelectric power plant, a women-run Co-Op, and a drinking water facility Planted trees to aid local restoration efforts
Volunteer, Friends of the Dunes September 16, 2023 Arcata, California Removed invasive species from sand dunes, supporting restoration efforts of the dunes Utilized plant removal techniques to effectively remove species Identified invasive species, ensuring removal of the correct species
RELEVANT COURSEWORK
Environmental Conflict Resolution, Environmental Law and Regulation, Environmental Methods, Ecosystem Ecology, Forest and Rangeland Policy, General Botany, Geospatial Concepts, Introduction to Soil Science, Physical Geography

title: CSU ESS 330 Projects
section: Manipulating and Summarizing Data with dplyr
text:
Manipulating and Summarizing Data with dplyr
Lab 2: Minnesota Tree Growth

Explored data manipulation using dplyr using a long term tree growth observation record from Minnesota.


knitr::include_graphics("img/covid.jpg")

title: CSU ESS 330 Projects
text:
Data Wrangling and Visualization
Lab 3: COVID-19

Worked with a large COVID dataset.
Practiced data management by creating reports and visualizations.


knitr::include_graphics("img/LTER.png")

title: CSU ESS 330 Projects
text:
Projects Website
Lab 1: Personal Portfolio

Built a static users site with Github Pages.

knitr::include_graphics("img/minnesota_trees.jpg")

title: CSU ESS 330 Projects
text:
Statistics in R
Lab 4: LTER Network Data

Conducted basic statistical tests in R such as chi-square, t-tests, and correlation tests.
Utilized Long-Term Ecological Research (LTER) Network Data to conduct statistical tests and interpret results.


knitr::include_graphics("img/tidymodels.png")

title: CSU ESS 330 Projects
text:
Using Tidymodels & CAMELS Data
Lab 6: Machine Learning in Hydrology

Utilized tidymodels, a helpful tool for machine learning and statistical modeling in R.
Worked with the CAMELS (Catchment Attributes and Meteorology for Large-sample Studies), a large dataset of many characteristics of river basins in the United States.
Explored predictive modeling.


knitr::include_graphics("img/machine_learning.webp")

title: CSU ESS 330 Projects
text:
Machine Learning
Lab 8: The Whole Game Plan

Created a machine learning pipeline by putting together knowledge of the full machine learning process.
Included feature engineering, resampling, machine learning goals, types of models and R engines, performance evaluation, and final model tuning.


knitr::include_graphics("img/global_map.jpg")

title: CSU ESS 330 Projects
text:
Distances and Projections
Lab 10: Distance from the Border Zone

Visualized data on a spatial scale.
Injested and built simple feature objects from R packages and CSVs.
Manipulated geometries and coordinate systems.
Calculated distances and built maps using ggplot.


knitr::include_graphics("img/poudre.jpg")

title: CSU ESS 330 Projects
section: Final Project: Snow Water Equivalent and Streamflow
text:
Final Project: Snow Water Equivalent and Streamflow
Lab 5: Quarto Manscripts & Ideation, Lab 7: Introduction, Data, Methods, Lab 9: Results and Discussion

Explored tools and functionality of Quarto Manuscripts.
Synthesized literature to explore the relationship between snow water equivalent (SWE) and streamflow
Worked with SWE and streamflow data to analyze statistical tests, time series analysis, and correlations between variables.
Wrote a scientific research-style paper reporting findings and data analysis.
